intro: Pedicularis alberti, commonly known as the Albert's lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its spurred flowers, which are typically pink or purple in color. It grows in rocky or alpine habitats and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Due to its specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
